definition: lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed

sentences.english: Thy clanking chain, and Erin's yet green wounds.
sentences.chinese: 你鎖鏈的鋃鐺，愛爾蘭的新傷。

sentences.english: He was accused of graft and embezzlement and was chained and thrown into prison.
sentences.chinese: 他因被指控貪污盜竊而鋃鐺入獄。

sentences.english: Because of his bragging—and his great skill—Gen lands in the King's prison, shackled to the wall of his cell.
sentences.chinese: 鄭因爲他的高超技術和自吹自擂而鋃鐺入獄。

sentences.english: Endless war is taken to justify endless incarcerations.
sentences.chinese: 無盡的戰爭以證明無數人鋃鐺入獄是合理的。

sentences.english: He was caught by the police and ended up behind bars.
sentences.chinese: 他被警察逮捕，落了個鋃鐺入獄的下場。
